name: Magnetic Force on Moving Charge
explanation: A moving charge experiences a magnetic force perpendicular to both velocity and magnetic field. Force magnitude: F = qvB sin θ, where θ is angle between v and B. Force direction given by right-hand rule. This explains how magnets work, particle accelerators, and electromagnetic devices. Magnetic force does no work (always perpendicular to motion).

examples.problem: Electron (q = -1.6×10⁻¹⁹ C) moves at 10⁶ m/s perpendicular to 0.5T magnetic field. What is force?
Why does magnetic force cause circular motion?
examples.solution: Force is always perpendicular to velocity, changing direction but not speed
steps: Changes direction, not magnitude of velocity

proof: F = q(v × B). Force on moving charge perpendicular to both velocity and field. Magnitude: F = qvB sin(θ). Direction from right-hand rule. Proof: Moving charge creates current, current in magnetic field experiences force. Force does no work (always perpendicular to motion).
